alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 22 at 7:01PM EST until December 24 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Concord River At Lowell affecting Middlesex County. Charles River At Dover affecting Middlesex and Norfolk Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Middle Haddam, Hartford... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Concord River...including Lowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding is expected along the river in portions of Wethersfield, Glastonbury, Rocky Hill and Cromwell. The high waters and swift flows will disrupt some cross river ferry services. Upstream of Hartford, flooding will continue to affect portions of Windsor. Immediate river roads may become impassable in all of these communities. Further downstream flooding will continue to overspread sections of Portland, Middletown as well as Chester. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:31 PM EST Friday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:31 PM EST Friday was 20.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday morning and continue falling to 11.9 feet late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.5 feet on 04/17/1867. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at noon EST.
